creditline: Lent by the Wang Xing Lou Collection
department: Chinese, South and Southeast Asian Art
description: pink enamel bowl, white interior and underside of foot
text: The exterior of this bowl is elaborately decorated on a brilliant coral-red ground with three panels, each exposing a large pink peony with bluish-green stems and leaves on an opaque yellow ground. While inspired by earlier palace workshop wares of the Kang-hsi reign (1662-1722), the rich palette here combines coral-red and translucent green colors taken from the earlier "famille-verte" palette with the opaque enamels of the later "famille-rose" color scheme.
title: Bowl
